abstract: The chief executive of the Nasdaq stock market acknowledged on Sunday that technical issues had marred the debut of Facebook as a public company on Friday, but contended that the missteps had not affected the performance of the company’s shares.
snippet: The chief executive of the Nasdaq stock market acknowledged on Sunday that technical issues had marred the debut of Facebook as a public company on Friday, but contended that the missteps had not affected the performance of the company’s shares.
lead_paragraph: 10:46 p.m. | Updated The chief executive of the Nasdaq stock market acknowledged on Sunday that technical issues had marred the debut of Facebook as a public company on Friday, but contended that the missteps had not affected the performance of the company’s shares.

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
